intro: Monophyllanthe, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Monophyllanthe is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
